item.title: + Bio
item.description: Alan C. Taylor I grew up on a mountain swallowed up by kudzu just across the river from Chattanooga, Tennessee. In college and graduate school I studied nineteenth-century American literature, culture, and history. I’m interested in backcountry settlements in the early republic and conflicts between Native peoples and settlers. I teach writing and research at Dartmouth College. I wrote The Open Handbook—a free, open-source reference book that introduces students to the conventions of academic writing and research.
